text: Bottle thanks Kapusil. Golden yella little to no carbonation. Apples, pears, booze, white wine and bready yeast aroma. Tart belgian strong ale with strawbeery, peach, almond and bready yeast. Really good and kicks.

0.75l bottle. Hazy golden body with a huge white head. Aroma of bread, white wine, apples, nutmeg, lemon zest and a tiny bit of vinegar. Taste of bread, white wine, lemon zest, sugar syrup and nutmeg. The white wine character is in the center for sure. Great beer.

Bottle: Poured a hazy dirty golden color ale with a large off-white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of candi sugar with some vinous notes and some light oak notes. Taste is a mix of sweet Belgium malt offset by some grapes and vinous notes with some residual sugar notes with some oak which add some dryer notes. Body is full with great carbonation. Rich complex beer with wine barrel balancing some of the richness.

Moins complexe que la Bush prestige, elle est plus fruitée avec une robe plus claire, des arômes de fruits mûrs, de marc de raisin sur un fond malté et épicé. La bouche est ample, ronde, fruitée, avec une belle bulle onctueuse et une finale doucereuse.

Bush de Charmes
Bottle split at L42, thanks to Kenneth, 23/01/17.
Hazed orange with a decent off white cap.
Nose is yeast esters, spice, caramel, light booze dance, tangy orange.
Taste comprises light funky notes, tangy fruit rinds, boosty, light spice, caramel, yeast flicker.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a rising alcohol level.
Solid enough Belgoo string if a little harsh in places.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 23rd January 2017Level 42 Bottleshare. Very hazy gold beer, good pale cream colour head. Palate is smooth and semi dry with a trailing fine crispness. Smooth light malts, sweetish, light cream. Floral sweetness. Pleasant white wine vibe with a touch of white port. Trace of bubblegum esters. Very drinkable.

75cl bottle shared at Level 42. Many thanks to Ken for this one. It pours a hazed golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is fruity estery with notes of citrus stone fruit and light bourbon. Taste is also sweet fruity with notes of bourbon stone fruit melon and pineapple. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very nice and interesting

Bottle thanks to Ken. It pours cloudy pale orange with a medium white head. The aroma is sweet, sticky, tapioca, white grape, creamy, vinous, oak, vanilla, dessert wine, apple,pear and toffee. The taste is crisp, tart, vinous, white grape, some acidity, sherbet, apple, pear, melon, sugary, vinous, dessert wine and warming alcohol with a warming finish. Medium - full body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Interesting and quaffable. Good one.

Cork and cage bottle share at One Canada Square with many thanks to Kenny. As Bush de Charmes Cuvee Specialie 2015, 10.5%. Dark matte orange, opaque, lightly sparkling, foamy off-white head, full lacing. Aroma is apple, varnish, melon, syrupy sugars. Body is light, very frothy, highly carbonation. Taste is airy, chalky, booze, tonic notes, dry finish. Quite thin and harsh overall.

Bottle shared on Level 42 23/01/2017. Many thanks to Kenny for this one. A hazed golden orange coloured pour with a. Lasting frothy off white head. Aroma is alcohol, Belgian yeast, apricot and grapey fruits, tart fruit, orange. Flavour is composed of alcohol, semi sweet dessert wine, vinous fruit, oak, solvent alcohol. Palate is semi sweet rounded, moderate carbonation, frothy, tangy white wine. Really complex, little solvent.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Kenny. Pours unclear gold with a fluffy, off-white head. Novel aroma, some soft funk, sweat, ripe citrus, pale wood, peach. Medium sweet flavour with more strong woody character, a little citric bite, lemon peel, wheat bread. Full bodied with massaging carbonation. Finishes with more pale wood, peach, white grape. Novel stuff.

Blond bier met witte wand klevende schuimkraag. Geur: geparfumeerd, kamille, citrus, yoghurt, bloemig. Smaak: licht zurig, witte wijn, iets vettig, wat alcoholisch. Verfijnd en in balans. Romig en volmondig. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: droog, wat zurig. Mooi degustatiebier!

A hazed golden ale with a thin white head. In aroma, nice fruity malt with light grassy hops, light herbaceous character, light yeast notes, nice and smooth. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity malt with light candy sugar, light curacao, coriander, light perfumy notes, alcohol warmth, very nice. Bottle at Lautre oeil.

Bottle, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Gourmet. Pours hazy orange with a medium, frothy, off-white head. Aroma has sweet malts, red wine, oak, light doughy, esters, red apple. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has sweet malts, lots of red wine, oak dryness, melon, light vinious. Good dryness, solid balance. Wonderful.

Olive bottle, 75 cl, vintage 2015, via Philippe Boutin (merci!), savoured on December 3 2016; eye: orangey with a caramel hue, semi-hazy, good effervescence, good tan head made up of rather large bubbles and that remains, slight lacing; nose: spices (including slight clove), Belgian yeast, malt, candied sugar, honey, pear; mouth: spices, Belgian yeast, malt, candied sugar, white wine, light hops, light honey, acidity, finale in Belgian yeast with presence of white wine, medium body, rather carbonated, slightly bitter, lightly sweet, lightly vinous texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille olive, 75 cl, millésime 2015, via Philippe Boutin (merci!), savourée le 3 décembre 2016; il : orangée avec une teinte caramel, semi-voilée, bonne effervescence, bonne mousse fauve formée de bulles plutôt grosses et qui se maintient, très légère dentelle; nez : épices (incluant très léger clou de girofle), levure belge, malt, sucre candi, miel, poire; bouche : épices, levure belge, malt, sucre candi, vin blanc, léger houblon, léger miel, acidité, finale en levure belge avec présence de vin blanc, corps moyen, plutôt carbonatée, très légèrement amère, légèrement sucrée, texture légèrement vineuse; en résumé : bien

Bottle, 75cL. @Naintré, with my dad. A yellow-opaque hazy beer with a big white head ; average retention. Wood, caramel, roast, bread, light herb, alcohol, plum. Medium sweet, round, warming, light dry bitter note. Good body, avearge texture, good carbonation, light to medium woody warming finish. Overall, very good ; more carbonated than Bush Blond ; "lasting character".

Proefglas van 75cl-fles op WBA-tasting bij Freddy. Merci! U: Troebel stroblond met een witte schuimkraag. G: Moutzoet, lichte alcoholtoets, zoete witte wijn en een hint van gist. S: Zeer zoet met een licht bittertje. Granen, witte wijn en wat gist. M: Volle body met medium carbonatie.

75 cl bottle vintage 2014 @ home
Aroma has dried apricot and some biscuits. Flavour is surprisingly tart with lemon and apricot. Finishes with alcohol, some bush leaves and even more tart lemon. Also some milky tones in the finish. Unexpected, this has something in common with some American bretta-ales. Not exactly my thing but not bad either.

Bière dexception, à la robe dorée et opaque et à leffervescence très présente. Le nez est très porté sur les levures. Très bonne longueur en bouche avec des notes de miel et de citron. La Bush de Charmes sapparente très bien à des vins liquoreux, quelle remplacera à merveille sur des desserts au chocolat amer. Goût plus personnel, je la trouve un brin trop sucrée avec un palais alourdi en fin de dégustation.
Interesting mild aroma. Somewhat smokey and burnt sugar flavour. Smooth velvet texture.

Aroma:

Slight/medium aroma of malts, Belgian yeast, honey, wood, vanilla, green apples and wine.

Appearance:

Opaque golden/amber beer with heavy yeast and with a large off-white/white head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium sweet, slightly bitter, dry and acidic with malts, Belgian yeast, honey, wood, vanilla, green apples and white wine.

Overall:

There is a slight trace of the beer, but it got almost completely taken over by the white wine barrels it aged on. This beer is so complex thanks to this, it is simply amazing for the hot (read 27°C) day it is.

Bottle given by my friend Ruy. Insane amount of carbonation - bodes well! Aromas of apples and the famed Meursault wine barrels. Taste is almost overpowering: winey notes, for sure, but also green apples, minerals and everything else that makes you want to think that you are drinking a wine and not a beer. But, to be fair, some hops, distinct yeast and a shadow of malts. Excellent. Long-lasting taste.

opalescent golden colour, huge, medium dense white head; aroma of dried fruits, raisins, cooked apple, biscuits, oak barrel, hints of acetone and slight buttery as well as vanilla notes; taste is similar to the aroma with vinous and cheesy notes; amazing Belgian strong ale with some geuze-like notes

bottle at home. Pours cloudy orange to yellow, small white bubbly head? Intensely rich white chardonnay wine aroma: loads of oak and vanilla, sweet alcohol, soft butter, Full body, low on carb, a little barrel sour, high on alcohol. Crisp malt taste, alcohol heat, oaky chardonnay. A rich beer, liked the aroma more than the taste.

Robe cuivrée très trouble, crémeuse.
Col de mousse persistant de petites bulles et qui colle joliment.
Arômes puissants et très présents de fruits, dépices, de raisins, de vin, de vignes.

En bouche ça démarre sur les fruits jaunes (pêches, poires, melon) pour finir sur des notes plus vineuses, raisin, liqueur, Monbazillac, Sauternes et Riesling.

Complexe et délicieux.
Des notes très présentes de bourgogne dans cette nouvelle série Bush murie en foudres de Charmes Meursault. Grande richesse gustative. Le mariage est excellent

Pours a short white head with nice mirabelle plum or yellow berries aromas. Clear orange body. In mouth, green and yellow berries. Oak is not felt. Nice, round and medium warmth and length.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A golden beer with an orange notes, strong bubbling, a head is big, clouding and blond. Aroma has strong grapes and fruitness, flowers, sourness, some barrel and earthyness. Interesting aroma, the wine barrel is strongly presented. Taste has grapes and other fruitness, dry barrel and flowers, strenght of alcohol but thats not taste, also some sourness. Medium bodied, strong carbonation thats lightening the body. Interesting beer, the barrel aging is strong but not a bad way. Strong grapes are quite confusing.
75 cl bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, slight butterish. Sweet, fruity, phenolic. Bitter. Smooth. Wooden. Light wienous. Sweet and mellow fruity finish.

Bottle sampled at Essen Winterbier festival 2015. Appears clear golden with an off white head. Aroma of caramel, strange light fruits, herbs, yeast, floral notes and alcohol. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet. Above medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at the Essen Winter Beer Festival, 2015. Poured a clear light amber with a thin broken white head. The aroma is fresh apples, zesty lemon. The flavour is light sweet / sour with a smooth fruity alcoholic palate. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation.

White burgundy barrel aged tripel, 75 cl luxury bottle from Willems. Egg-white, medium sized, frothy to even rocky head breaking in the middle after some time and leaving thick papery lacing on the edges; colour is an initially lightly hazy old gold with a warm yellow hue becoming increasingly misty and orangey as the bottle is emptied. Strong aroma of gooseberries and gentle lemon zest, hints of yoghurt, green apple, yellow Zespri kiwi, pear, dry white wine, subtle vanilla-like tannins and oak, tropical flowers, soapy starfruit, some wet leather, hay, lime, white bread, canned pineapple, calvados. Very fruity onset, strong gooseberry, pear and pineapple, sweet and honeyish on one side and tart (even softly lemony) on the other side; soft carbo, very subtle and adding to a vinous, slick, smooth moufhfeel. The sweet-and-sourish fruitiness play along well into the finish over a background of lightly bready, caramelly and honeyish malts gliding effortlessly over the tongue. Finish is a continuation of this play of malts and esters but dried with an oaky, clearly drying but still gentle, elegant woodiness and peppery, leafy hop bitterishness playing its merely structural role very well, as well as the expected glow of warming, white port-like alcohol; an unmistakable white wine flavour remains after swallowing, well balanced with the sweet malts and drying aspects of the beer itself. Honeyish sweetness clings a bit to the throat, as is the case with the basic beer as well; other than that, this proves to be quite interesting, the white wine has been integrated in a tasteful way, interfering with the beer in a lively manner without ruining it, almost duelling with it as it were, and lending it a kind of noble, near sour ale-like profile. The blonde equivalent to Bush des Nuits I guess, but in any case another fascinating Dubuisson luxury product. Classy dessert beer and worth the price for sure, very Belgian and indeed very winey as well, not quite unlike e.g. Dolles Zannekin and other of the better beer-wine crossovers. Ideal to lure wine people into beer, perhaps?

75cl bottle shared in our hotel room in Leuven. Hazy golden / orange with a medium white soapy head. Full body with moderate carbonation. Nice well balanced sour, bitter and sweet tones. Citrus, lemon, yeast, funk, pineapple, vine, vanilla and other herbs and spices. What a tasty full flavoured slightly sour great brew!

Sample at beer bloggers conference, Brussels 2015
lightly spicey fruity nose, spritzy carbonation, vinous, oaky, vanilla, caramel, long vinous finish. Rich and complex but not heavy going
Hazy gold with a fine head, tart grapey note almost but not quite reminiscent of Nelson Sauvin. Fruity-sweet  maybe just a tad too sweet - over drying alcohol and a dry bitterness.
Sampled from bottle @ RBBSG 2015. Lightly hazy yellow color, small white head. Smell and taste malts, a hint of fruit, some yeast. Quite nice.

Huge, very fine, just off-white head, irregular and lacey over very carbonated fully orange beer. Very vinous nose, white wine in old wood; citrus, lemon even a bit lambic - or rather gueuze - like aroma. Toasted malts with lemon and spritzy CO2, heavy alcohol in the background, outstanding sour-sweet balance. Again close to spontaneous fermentation. And vinous, of course. Despite the massive alcohol & alcoholheat, quite spritzy and light. This is utterly awesome ; by far the best from Dubuisson.

4/VII/15 - 75cl bottle @ RBBSG IV - BB: n/a (2015-866)  Thanks to 77ships for sharing the bottle!
Little cloudy beige to blond beer, creamy yellow head, little stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: sweet, yeast, bit lemony, very fruity, pineapple touch. MF: soft carbon, medium to light body. Taste: bit sourish, very fruity, little funky, yeast, coriander. Aftertaste: sweet, peaches, very yeasty, hoppy touch, alcohol.

Dégustée au RBBSG 2015. Cheers all! Bière blonde typiquement Belge proposant une magnifique corpulence accentuée par une riche couronne blanche et imposante. Tête typiquement belge, larchitecture de la mousse est spectaculaire! Je commence la conclusion: cette bière est très apparentée à la Westmalle. Nez très levuré (à la belge) encore une fois semblable à celle mentionnée ainsi quà plusieurs triples belges. Quelques agrumes, de la levure, un certain houblon fait également son apparition lorsquon y prête attention. Effervescence remarquable (presque trop grande, mais ça va encore), beaucoup de corps car les malts ont libéré une importante quantité de sucre et forte en alcool qui se marie bien avec lensemble qui se veut plutôt extrême dans toutes les directions. Bonne bière mais qui ne réinvente rien.

750 ml. bottle sampled @ Hot & Sweaty RBBSG 2015. Purchased @ Bierhandel Willems & Zoon. Hazy golden, lighter golden little white head; Nose is vanilla, rather fizzy, basic strong wine & honey sweetness, big fruity esters, Taste is touch fizzy, yoghurt mixed with yeast & white wine, sweetish candy-like, vanilla, yoghurt body with light spirit qualities, light spirit, fermenting white grapes, Elegant but also a bit dull. Decent beer but heavily overprized in my opinion. Not a bad but one should expect more at this price-point.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2015 Fles gekocht bij firmabier.nl. Gedeeld en uitgeschonken in craquelé Bush graal glazen. Troebel goudblond bier met witte schuimkraag die zich terugtrekt. Aroma's van eikenhout, witte wijn, fruitige esters, banaan, citrus en florale aroma's. Complex zoet en licht zurig smaakpallet van wit en geel fruit als peer, banaan, gefermenteerde witte druiven, citrusfruit, Chardonnay wijn, vanille, Belgische gist en eikenhout. De alcohol van 10,5% is volledig verborgen. De vineuze aroma's en smaaktonen zijn ook bij deze Bush de Charmes weer van een uitzonderlijk hoog niveau, net als bij de Bush Prestige en de Bush de Nuits. Hoewel die twee bieren nog iets meer complex van smaak zijn. De afdronk is fruitig, licht droog en enigszins houtig. Wederom een zeer smaakvol hout gelagerd bier van Dubuisson, met nu de Bush Blonde als basisbier.
Bottle at RBBSG, thanks for sharing 77ships. Yeasty, alcohol, grapes, nothing special and way overpriced.

Bottle from belgiuminabox.com. 
Pours rather clear blonde, hood and flufdy white head is stable. Amell is to the sweet side. Grainy, some tannines. Taste is very full of wine, oak, not really balancd. But the aftertaste turns very nice, sweet malts and wine oak. Along with a very fruity aspect.

Bouteille 75cl, anno 2014 de Bierhalle Dekoninck.
De couleur dorée tirant vers un léger orangé et présentant un trouble moyen. Le col est blanc sans présenter une rétention particulière.
Arôme offre de belles effluves de chênes, ici un chêne français, avec un rétro-nasal fruité tirant vers un raisin blanc - venant du vin mais aussi dun accompagnement fruité presque exotique.
Palais est agréable et les 11% se font ressentir au fur et à mesure de la dégustation. On note une appréciation pour cette maturation en barrique qui confère à la bière une vertue proche dune vin blanc, et donc dune bière de dégustation qui souvre avec la température. Sur ce point, je suis un peu en désaccord avec la descriptiond elétiquette qui cosneille e la déguster à 10 degrés car pour moi, même à 15° cétait parfait et avec le temps le palais sest grandement ouvert. On retrouve un léger résiduel boisé qui procure une fine note sèche en bouche. Le fruité de ce vin blanc reste bien présent avec une petite note amer en fin de bouche qui semble augurer les qcq houblons venant de la Bush Blonde. Je retrouve aussi une pointe fruitée exotique, au même titre que larôme, qui me rappelle la mangue voire une purée de pêche. Sur la fin, le boisé continue à percer ajoutant des notes sèches assez plaisantes et un certain résiduel sucré qui perce en toute fin de bouche. On reste cependant, dans une lignée très belge comme cela se ressent par le profil levure. Bière correcte, qui vaut bien ses 17 à déguster à son aise. Reste un très bon produit dexception.
